title: The Lion and the Jewel
author: Wole Soyinka
summary: A play that contrasts traditional Yoruba values with Westernized education in a Nigerian village.

title: Second Class Citizen
author: Buchi Emecheta
summary: The story of Adah, a Nigerian woman who moves to London and struggles against overwhelming odds to become a writer.

title: Unexpected Joy at Dawn
author: Alex Agyei-Agyiri
summary: Explores the lived experience of West Africans during the era of mass deportations between Ghana and Nigeria.

title: Purple Hibiscus
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
summary: The story of Kambili and her brother Jaja, growing up in a wealthy but oppressive household in Nigeria.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
summary: The struggle between an aging fisherman and a giant marlin out in the Gulf Stream.

title: Women of Owu
author: Femi Osofisan
summary: A retelling of Euripides' The Trojan Women, set in the aftermath of the 1821 Owu war in Yorubaland.
